summary: This is an email chain from November 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel scheduling a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. The content includes a brief substantive update about a meeting in California with a potential victim, noting difficulties with an enticement charge and the victim's indecision about pursuing a criminal case.

events.title: California meeting with potential victim
events.description: A meeting was held in California with a potential victim. It did not yield significant new information, and prosecutors determined an enticement charge was unlikely due to timing/location facts. The victim was unsure about pursuing a criminal case.

events.title: Scheduled proffer session
events.description: An individual referred to as 'she' is scheduled for a limited proffer session to discuss her background, set for a week from the email date (Tuesday, November 26, 2019).

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) were actively discussing the Epstein investigation in November 2019.
A meeting with a potential victim in California did not provide significant new information and revealed challenges in bringing an enticement charge due to jurisdictional/timing issues.
The potential victim was uncertain about pursuing a criminal case, with plans to circle back with her attorneys later in November 2019.
Investigators were continuing to work through a 'pile of memos' and had scheduled a limited proffer session with an individual for late November 2019.
